title: Laws for Sin Offerings
summary: Leviticus 4 introduces the sin offering, required when someone unintentionally sinned against Godâ€™s commands. Different sacrifices were required depending on whether the sinner was a priest, leader, or individual.

faq.question: Who needed to offer a sin offering?
faq.answer: Priests, the entire community, leaders, and individuals who sinned unintentionally.

faq.question: What was done with the blood?
faq.answer: It was sprinkled in the sanctuary and poured at the base of the altar.
